title: Natural Gas Looks Evident Enough For A Steep Bounce Ahead
text:
On analysis of the movements of futures, in different time frames, I find that the Natural Gas futures look evident enough for a steady move during September-October, 2019; despite the thick presence of bears. No doubt that the growing pessimism among the traders about Natural Gas, which has constantly been trading in a bearish phase since February 2019; but the Natural Gas futures have given clear signal about the upcoming bouncing move on September 5th, 2019.

I find that the Natural Gas futures have a long history to take sharp steep moves against all odds, even beyond the expectations of traders, who remain focused upon the oversupply issue of . On the other hand, a sudden changing directional move of Natural Gas futures result in sudden loss/profit to traders; whenever they find a sudden gap – up or down – on the first opening session of the week.

I find that the “Ichimoku cloud” provides enough evidences before such sudden moves well in advance. Watch my video on analysis of the movements of Natural Gas futures below.

No doubt, that trading the most liquid commodity of the world, Natural Gas, always remain very difficult task, but Ichimoku Clouds help a lot in reading the upcoming moves in Natural Gas futures. Natural Gas futures, behaves in particular manners before a breakout move, above or below the Ichimoku Cluods; in different time frames.

Finally, I conclude that the futures look to be a good buying bet at the current levels, because of their reactionary move after the announcement of build-up in Natural Gas inventory levels, announced on September 5th, 2019.
